content.question: The plant manager of a company that makes pillows claims that only 8 percent of the pillows made have a stitching defect. The quality control director thought that the percent might be different from 8 percent and selected a random sample of pillows to test. The director tested the hypotheses <math alttext="H sub 0: p equals 0.08" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.08</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a: p is not equal to 0.08" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0.08</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> at the significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of the test was 0.03. Assuming all conditions for inference were met, which of the following is the correct conclusion?

choices.label: The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to suggest the true proportion of stitching defects is less than 0.08.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to suggest the true proportion of stitching defects is not 0.08.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to suggest the true proportion of stitching defects is greater than 0.08.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is not rejected. There is convincing evidence to suggest the true proportion of stitching defects is not 0.08.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is not rejected. There is not convincing evidence to suggest the true proportion of stitching defects is not 0.08.

There is convincing evidence to suggest the true proportion of stitching defects is not 0.08.
